intro: Turritis curtisiliqua, commonly known as the Canary Island bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
